review_content: 500ml Dose. Strohgelbes naturtrübes Bier. Der weisse luftige Schaum zerfällt sofort. Intensiver Zitronenduft. Hat schon was von Spüli. Ziemlich süss im Antrunk. Zitronenlimo, wenig bis kein Bier.

Appearance: cloudy pale yellow with a moderate white airy head of low retention.
Aroma and taste: lots of lemon, malt, sugar. Light to medium sweet and sour. Citric acid aftertaste.
Mouth feel: light to medium body, lively carbonation.
Overall: the grapefruit version is better.

Can 50 cl. Straw yellow color, a bit hazy, loose white foam. Aroma: like lemon, freshly squeezed lemon juice and zest, a little metal. Sweet taste, lemonade, lemon zest, traces of malt, refreshes, for summer.

Da ich ein paarmal vom lokalen Supermarkt das Billigbier-Regal durchforste, um einem Kollegen ein Pausenbier mitzubringen, suche ich immer solche Biere, welche ich schon mal getrunken habe, wo aber eine tiefere Bewertung aussteht.
Diesen Radler hatte ich schon vor einigen Jahren, aber ich glaube unter einem anderen Namen.
Es ist ein überraschend zitronensaurer Radler, der tatsächlich natürlich im Geschmack rüberkommt. Ein bisschen erinnert es mich an saure Haribo-Gummis. Als Erfrischung durchaus denkbar, als Bier-Ersatz aber nicht.
At a tasting, small bubbly head, hazy extremely pale orange color, aroma and flavor of sprite and chemicals, feels diluted. A waste of space.
Can sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Oren. As Egger Radler Lemon. Hazy pale yellow. Cheap artificial lemonade, sweet and slightly tart, light-bodied. Drinkable as a soft drink.
0.5 l can. Totally averagr macro radler. Sweet, artificial lemon taste and short finish. Light bodied, easily drinkable. Way too sweet for me.

500 ml can. Cloudy yellow color with small white head. Smells like sintetic lemon. Taste are usual too other cheap radlers more sintetic lemon with sweetness than normal lemonade or beer taste. Nothing to discuss more..
How: can Appearance: pale yellow, large head. Aroma: lemon. Palate: thin body, high carbonation.
The lemon soda is very dominant and makes the shandy becoming more of a flavored cider than a radler.

Can from Spar. Aroma mostly lemony flavouring, sugary. Hazy pale yellow colour, big head that disappears almost instantly. Taste is initially sweet and sugary, lemon flavouring. Well not only initially, that seems to be the formula for taste cover to cover. Eh. Well carbonated and refreshing, the finish somehow does not feel cloying and sticky, but still eh.
33 cl. dåse. 2,2 %. Endnu en af af de østriske radlere. Med lemon, super frisk og læskende, men mere sodavand end øl.
0,5l can. Not too sweetish sticky, but otherwise not much different to other Lemon Radlers I have tasted in the last weeks.
Lys gulbrun klar med lavt hvitt skum som forsvinner fort. Lett sitronlukt, korn og noe malt. Smaker mer sitronbrus enn lager. Kort.

Radler is not something I usually taste (or appreciate), The scent is lemon taste and is more soft drinks than beer. Actually it is very difficult to even distinguish some beer flavor but much concentration and proximity gives perhaps slightly hoppy bitterness towards the end. Wonderful refreshing summer beverage, but not comparable to beer.
500ml Dose. Strohgelbes naturtrübes Bier. Der weisse luftige Schaum zerfällt sofort. Intensiver Zitronenduft. Hat schon was von Spüli. Ziemlich süss im Antrunk. Zitronenlimo, wenig bis kein Bier.
Appearance: cloudy pale yellow with a moderate white airy head of low retention. Aroma and taste: lots of lemon, malt, sugar. Light to medium sweet and sour. Citric acid aftertaste.…

Can 50 cl. Straw yellow color, a bit hazy, loose white foam. Aroma: like lemon, freshly squeezed lemon juice and zest, a little metal. Sweet taste, lemonade, lemon zest, traces of malt, refreshes, for summer.

Da ich ein paarmal vom lokalen Supermarkt das Billigbier-Regal durchforste, um einem Kollegen ein Pausenbier mitzubringen, suche ich immer solche Biere, welche ich schon mal getrunken habe, wo aber eine tiefere Bewertung aussteht.…
At a tasting, small bubbly head, hazy extremely pale orange color, aroma and flavor of sprite and chemicals, feels diluted. A waste of space.
Can sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Oren. As Egger Radler Lemon. Hazy pale yellow. Cheap artificial lemonade, sweet and slightly tart, light-bodied. Drinkable as a soft drink.
0.5 l can. Totally averagr macro radler. Sweet, artificial lemon taste and short finish. Light bodied, easily drinkable. Way too sweet for me.

500 ml can. Cloudy yellow color with small white head. Smells like sintetic lemon. Taste are usual too other cheap radlers more sintetic lemon with sweetness than normal lemonade or beer taste. Nothing to discuss more..
How: can Appearance: pale yellow, large head. Aroma: lemon. Palate: thin body, high carbonation.
The lemon soda is very dominant and makes the shandy becoming more of a flavored cider than a radler.

Can from Spar. Aroma mostly lemony flavouring, sugary. Hazy pale yellow colour, big head that disappears almost instantly. Taste is initially sweet and sugary, lemon flavouring. Well not only initially, that seems to be the formula for taste cover to cover.…
33 cl. dåse. 2,2 %. Endnu en af af de østriske radlere. Med lemon, super frisk og læskende, men mere sodavand end øl.
0,5l can. Not too sweetish sticky, but otherwise not much different to other Lemon Radlers I have tasted in the last weeks.
Lys gulbrun klar med lavt hvitt skum som forsvinner fort. Lett sitronlukt, korn og noe malt. Smaker mer sitronbrus enn lager. Kort.

Radler is not something I usually taste (or appreciate), The scent is lemon taste and is more soft drinks than beer. Actually it is very difficult to even distinguish some beer flavor but much concentration and proximity gives perhaps slightly hoppy bitterness…

cloudy hazy yellow, white head.
aroma of lemon juice mainly, also faint malts. very nice aroma. flavor is artificial lemon mainly, and the overall impression is a decent radler, albeit a bit artificial.
Can at Yespr’s - clear yellow pour with whitehead. Lemon citric fruity aroma and taste, grassy and acidic, light palate, basic affair.

Can at yespr
Cloudy yellow colored with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of lemon soda.
Sweet and fruity flavor of lemon soda.
Sweet finish.

33 cl can @ Sankt Hans Tasting, Ulfborg

Aroma has strong lemonade notes and quite nothing else. Feels like some cleaning liquid. Flavour has bitter & tart lemonade and mild grainy tones. Feels a bit watery. More tart than radlers usually.
Can@fonefan. Hazy pale yellow colour, small head. Aroma is lemon, some parfumed soap and that’s about it. Flavour is lemon, mild tartness, and soapy notes.
Can @ fonefan tasting. Hazy pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, light malty, grapefruit and lemon. Flavor is medium sweet. Light dry finish. 210615

330 ml, dåse, 2,2 % ABV, BB 19/06/15, købt i Netto på Roskildevej i Valby, 26. januar 2015.
Bleg pære-farvet diset østrigsk Radler/frugtøl med ungefär 2 cm skumtop, som hurtigt svinder til et par mm.
Kraftig syrlig aroma af citron og grapefrugt.
Overvejende og lidt overvældende sødlig smag og ikke meget øl over produktet. Solid sødme og meget let bitterhed, intet surt eller salt. 
Ganske kraftig karboneret over medium, som nok giver friskhed, men også en over-skummende fornemmelse i munden. Tynd til olieret konsistens og en let krop. Kort eftersmag og ganske pludselig afslutning. 
Spændende bekendtskab, men alt for sødt og for lidt øl til min smag.
Hazy light yellow color. Aroma of citrus. Quite ok mixture, but its NOT a beer.

Can, 2.2%. Good lemon peel aroma, reminds me of Schweppes.Cloudy very very pale grey colour. Small creamy chalk white head. The flavour is sweet, but also has a good lemon peel note. Not very citric, but refreshing, and still reminding me of Schweppes.

Can @ Vinterslaget på Østersøen, Sønderborg. Pours hazy pale straw with airy white head. Intense aroma of citrus (or detergent) with some subtle malty notes. Sweet flavour of lemonade and aspartame, with faint malty notes. Sour-sweetish aftertaste. Well, drinkable but not enjoyable.
Hay, pale straw. Frothy white head. Clear, fresh lemon aroma. Nice lemon flavour, fluffy mouthfeel.

Can @ Home. Pours lightly hazy pale yellow with a white head. Aroma of light malt, lemon, white sugar. Flavor is light sweet, lemonlemonade, sugar. Thin to medium body, lively carbonation. Not bad for a soft drink. 181014

Can bought at a local Spar in Austria. The beer pours out in a hazy yellowish colour with low head and medium body.Aroma of mild lemonade and mild beer. Taste of natural lemon juice, mild lemonade and mild beer. Drinkable and ok.

Was soll man schon gross sagen koennen ? Ein nettes, sehr suesses Radler mit ein wenig Zitrone im Aroma. Perlung ok, Aromen kaum wahrnehmbar, jedoch ist der Geschmack recht nett zitronig-suess. Von Bier keine Spur. Unterm Schnitt, aber noch im Rahmen.

33 cl. can from fab NETTO served in a Flute. Unclear, pale golden colour with a fast fading, bubbly white head. Sweet aroma with artificial lemon, light grains and malts. Taste is sweet. Light body with a thin texture and a fizzy carbonation. Short, sweet finish with artificial lemon. Like a cheap lemon soda from your discounter, not very beer (-ish). Thank you, NETTO you’re awesome!
Dåse, smagt hos Borup, en ganske udemærket Sommer øl, som den er, er den jo god nok at drikke.
Can. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of lemon, malt and straw.
Can. A hazy yellow beer with a thin white head. The aroma has notes of lemons and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, straw, and hints of malt, leading to dry finish.
